text: Wilson Or Chong-shing, MH (; born 9 July 1973) is a Hong Kong politician. He is an executive committee member of the Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong (DAB), the largest pro-Beijing party. He is a member of Kwun Tong District Council, having represented Kwong Tak since 2000. Or won a seat on Kwun Tong District Council in 1999, as a member of the Democratic Alliance for the Betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), beating a candidate from the Democratic Party. He retained his seat in 2003 despite the party's negative image following its support for Basic Law Article 23 legislation, receiving the highest votes in the district. He went on to be re-elected in 2007, 2011 and 2015 unopposed. While serving on Kwun Tong District Council, he oversaw the expansion of the United Christian Hospital and construction of the East Kowloon Cultural Centre, as well as strengthening the accessibility in the district. In 2011, he was elected to the Election Committee, through the Hong Kong and Kowloon District Councils Subsector, which was responsible for selecting the Chief Executive in 2012. In 2013, he joined the DAB's executive committee. In the 2016 Legislative Council election, he won the seat formerly held by DAB veteran Chan Kam-lam in Kowloon East. He held his seat in the 2019 District Council elections. ==References== Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:District councillors of Kwun Tong District Category:Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong politicians Category:Hong Kong Federation of Trade Unions Category:Members of the Legislative Council of Hong Kong Category:HK LegCo Members 2016–2020 Category:Members of the Election Committee of Hong Kong, 2012–2017
title: Wilson Or
